definition: to worry about
to grasp/to hold/to operate/to manage/to control/to steer/to exercise/to drill (practice)/to play/to speak (a language)
variant of 肏[cao4]
old variant of 操[cao1]
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: much to worry about; they always make trouble for you.
sentences.chinese: 事要操心，还老是惹麻烦给你。

sentences.english: Each day has its own great grief or its little care.
sentences.chinese: 每天都有大的烦恼或小的操心。

sentences.english: "Not many would bother with your toothache, " Davo said.
sentences.chinese: 没有多少人会为你的牙痛操心的。

sentences.english: I agree with this, but it does bother me.
sentences.chinese: 我同意这样的说法，但这样的事情轮不上我来操心。

sentences.english: Also tell what guide dont have to worry about the cast, he will do his best.
sentences.chinese: 亦名告诉何导不用操心剧组的事，他会尽力而为。

sentences.english: Don’t you have a TPS report to take care of?
sentences.chinese: 你没有要操心的TPS报告吗？

sentences.english: You can reconfigure CXF easily without mucking with XML.
sentences.chinese: 你可以很容易的重新配置CXF，无需操心XML。

sentences.english: What they ambition to anxiety is a national essential accident, where have a free idea tube these small affairs?
sentences.chinese: 他们要操心的是国家大事，哪里有闲心管这些小事情？

sentences.english: Don't borrow trouble by worrying about next year.
sentences.chinese: 不要为明年的事儿瞎操心了。

sentences.english: Unless the economic recovery quickens very suddenly, plenty of people will struggle to pay those heating bills.
sentences.chinese: 除非是经济恢复非常强劲，多数人将为取暖费操心。

sentences.english: They have their own challenges and lives to worry about.
sentences.chinese: 他们有他们自己的挑战和生活去操心呢。

sentences.english: But what about India internet speed? Dont worry for China.
sentences.chinese: 印度网速多少？别操心中国网速慢了。

sentences.english: Don't be concerned about adult children any more, otherwise can not stop the annoying chatters.
sentences.chinese: 不要再替成年子女操心，才不会碎碎念。

sentences.english: You needn't worry about the children.
He could do it, nor need I worry.
sentences.chinese: 他能做好，这用不着我操心。

sentences.english: It's difficult for him not to niggle.
sentences.chinese: 他就喜欢在小事儿上操心。

definition: to take a lot of trouble (over sb or sth)/may I trouble you (to do sth)
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
to work hard/to look after
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to show an interest in/to get involved with
to work with one's brains/to rack one's brains/to worry
to tax one's mind and body/demanding (work)/dedicated (worker)/hard-working
carefully/meticulously/to set one's heart on sth
to manage/to handle
to worry/to be anxious
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
concerned/worried/disturbed/anxious
everything
to do sth in place of sb else
to bother about/to haggle/to bicker/to argue/plan/stratagem
at ease/to feel relieved/to set one's mind at rest/to keep one's mind on sth
